session.speaker: Tony Richards
session.bio: Tony Richards is a seasoned sales professional with extensive experience in account management and field sales. Currently serving as a Strategic Account Manager at Tricentis since August 2022, Tony previously worked at Micro Focus as a Field Sales Executive, where responsibilities included engaging with Fortune 100 C-Level decision makers to enhance DevOps implementations. Prior roles include Sales Executive at Exact, where focus was on ERP solutions for mid-sized manufacturers, and Account Executive at Dell, concentrating on SharePoint services in the New England and Eastern Canada regions. Additional experience spans various sales positions at Quest Software, AT&T Mobility, and Clear Channel Radio. Tony holds a degree from The Ohio State University, completed in 2007.
session.title: What the evolution of AI means for your Agile testing practice
session.abstract: Generative AI is more than a buzzword. Its most common form today is in the Large Language Models (LLMs) family. This hugely complex algorithm containing hundreds of billions of parameters can digest the information it consumes and return a granular, structured product that might’ve otherwise taken hours or even days to create manually. Developers are already taking advantage of AI tools such as Copilot to work more efficiently – and there’s no reason QA can’t do the same! Learn more in this session.
